messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] [NHEN-SpeakOut] Homeschooling in the News 4/23/01
messages.msgSnippet: I think you guys are remembering Ben Bennett, from Indiana.  Ben still works for NHEN and is currently on a few of their lists   But Ben is not Bill.  ;) Lisa
messages.messageBody:
I think you guys are remembering Ben Bennett, from Indiana. Ben still works
for NHEN and is currently on a few of their lists But Ben is not Bill. ;)

Lisa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] [NHEN-SpeakOut] Homeschooling in the News 4/23/01
messages.msgSnippet: The Bill Bennett that was on the list was a fundy (he called himself this and he and I discussed good fundies and 3Rs, so this was not a bad thing ).
messages.messageBody:
The Bill Bennett that was on the list was a "fundy" (he called himself this
and he and I discussed "good" fundies and 3Rs, so this was not a bad thing
<g>). He was very conservative and left (don't know if he returned) to join
a Christian men's homeschooling list (I think, mommy brain is kinda foggy
sometimes). At any rate, I think he wrote articles and just wondered if it
were one and the same.

Lynda

> Lynda

http://www.worldmag.com/world/issue/04-28-01/cover_2.asp

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] [NHEN-SpeakOut] Homeschooling in the News 4/23/01
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Lynda -- I assumed this was William J. Bennett, ex-secretary of education. ( A Child s Book of Virtues author.) Was he on this list? (Like, was he reeely
messages.messageBody:
Hi Lynda --

I assumed this was William J. Bennett, ex-secretary of education. ("A Child's
Book of Virtues" author.) Was he on this list? (Like, was he reeely
conservative?)

Laura

In a message dated 4/24/2001 2:28:01 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
lurine@... writes:

<< went to World Magazine because I wanted to check out the first article
(William Bennett as author?) and the link only takes me to a registration
point and then when I did a search it told me they had no articles written
by a William Bennett.

Did this link work for other folks??? I was curious as there use to be a
William "Bill" Bennett on this list (and HEM or maybe only on HEM??) and we
had some lively discussions and his writing was quite interesting. Anyone
know if they are one and the same?

Lynda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] [NHEN-SpeakOut] Homeschooling in the News 4/23/01
messages.msgSnippet: I went to World Magazine because I wanted to check out the first article (William Bennett as author?) and the link only takes me to a registration point and
messages.messageBody:
I went to World Magazine because I wanted to check out the first article
(William Bennett as author?) and the link only takes me to a registration
point and then when I did a search it told me they had no articles written
by a William Bennett.

Did this link work for other folks??? I was curious as there use to be a
William "Bill" Bennett on this list (and HEM or maybe only on HEM??) and we
had some lively discussions and his writing was quite interesting. Anyone
know if they are one and the same?

Lynda

messages.subject: [NHEN-SpeakOut] Homeschooling in the News 4/23/01
messages.msgSnippet: April 28 World Magazine has a group of articles in this week s issue on improving public schools and on Christian homeschooling. You have to complete a free
messages.messageBody:
April 28
World Magazine has a group of articles in this week's issue on improving
public schools and on Christian homeschooling. You have to complete a free
registration at World to read these:

A few lessons the public schools need to learn (William Bennett)
http://www.worldmag.com/world/issue/04-28-01/cover_2.asp

Aim High(er) (Michael Farris)
http://www.worldmag.com/world/issue/04-28-01/cover_6.asp

You're not in it alone (Molly Powell)
http://www.worldmag.com/world/issue/04-28-01/cover_7.asp

April 23
Tampa Tribune : An aspiring pilot, Osborne hoping to land scholarship
http://www.tampatrib.com/Sports/MGAR1G6MVLC.html
Teen homeschooler is a talented baseball player and pilot.

April 22
Toledo Blade : Michigan parents resist forced tests
http://www.toledoblade.com:80/apps/pbcs.dll/artikkel?Avis=TO&Dato=20010422&Kat

egori=NEWS04&Lopenr=104220025&Ref=AR
Homeschoolers oppose a Michigan bill that would require them to submit to
state testing.

April 18
Daily Herald : Teaching your kids to drive yourself
http://
dailynews.yahoo.com/h/cdh/20010418/lo/teaching_your_kids_to_drive_yourself_1.h

tml
Parent-taught drivers ed bill passes Ilinois Senate but is opposed by public
school officials and driving schools.

Minor mentions:

April 23
Philadelphia Daily News : Kobe's mystery marriage
http://dailynews.philly.com:80/content/daily_news/2001/04/23/local/KOBE23C.htm

Star Tribune : Young chess champs emerge
http://www2.startribune.com/stOnLine/cgi-bin/article?thisStory=84029582

April 22
Empire Tribune : DISD faces budget issues due to enrollment
http://www.empiretribune.com/empiretribune/myarticles.asp?P=400073&S=425&PubID

=7059&EC=0

World Net Daily : Tyranny naked
http://worldnetdaily.com/news/article.asp?ARTICLE_ID=22520

Alameda Times Star : Smooth day at school's clinic
http://search.newschoice.com/GPC_StoryDisplay.asp?story=d:\index\newsarchives\

angts\fpg\20010420\808239_t2as220.txt&searchtext=home-school

Salt Lake Tribune : Yard-Sale Buffs Spring Into Action
http://www.sltrib.com/04222001/sunday/90812.htm

April 21
Newschoice : Stewards of the land
http://search.newschoice.com/GPC_StoryDisplay.asp?story=d:\index\newsarchives\

midsen\fpg\20010421\811505_tfront.txt&searchtext=home-schooled

visor_1.html


Laura Derrick
